page.title:
The Legislative Background
The Legislative Background
page.normal_text:
The Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) Program
The Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) Program

was created by the Small Business Job Protection
was created by the Small Business Job Protection w a s
c r e a t e d
b y
t h e
S m a l l
B u s i n e s s
J o b
P r o t e c t i o n

It’s a federal tax credit incentive created to:
It’s a federal tax credit incentive created to:

Encourage private sector employers to create jobs and training opportunities for disadvantaged individuals from 12 target groups that encounter significant barriers to employment.
Encourage private sector employers to create jobs
and training opportunities for disadvantaged individuals
from 12 target groups that encounter significant barriers f r o m

to employment.

Here are the 12 groups:
Here are the 12 groups:
page.enlisting:
1. Long term Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) recipients 2. Other TANF recipients 3. Veterans 4. 18-39 year old Food Stamp recipients 5. 18-39 year old Designated Community 6. 16-17 year old summer youth 1. Long term Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) recipients

Who Qualifies for the WOTC Program?
Who Qualifies for the WOTC Program?

WOTC is equal to 25% of “qualified” first (1st) -year’s wages if the “new hire” worked at least 120 hours.

page.title:
How Do Employers Apply for WOTC? There are two forms employers must complete for each new hire: ◦ IRS Form 8850: “Pre-Screening Notice and Certification Request” This Must be submitted with ORIGINAL employer and employee signatures and dates (no exceptions).

page.title:
What Does Timely Filing Mean?
What Does Timely Filing Mean?
page.enlisting:
* Note: When the last day of the 28 calendar day period ends on a Saturday, Sunday or holiday, the next succeeding business day will be treated as the last day of the period (the 28th day).
* Note: When the last day of the 28 calendar day period *

picture.name: Image318
picture.caption: To be considered timely, the IRS Form 8850, and the ETA 9061 must be submitted to the VEC not later than the 28th calendar day * following the new employee’s ‘employment-start date.’
